acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, Lusha offers a free tier with 5 credits per month. This is enough for light prospecting but most active reps will need the Pro plan at $29/month for 480 credits.

mainEntity.name: How accurate is Lusha's contact data?

acceptedAnswer.text: Lusha claims 80%+ email accuracy. G2 reviewers generally confirm solid US email data but note weaker accuracy for EU contacts and phone numbers compared to Cognism.
Lusha is simpler and faster for basic contact lookup. Apollo offers a larger database, email sending, and CRM features. Choose Lusha for speed and simplicity; Apollo for an all-in-one platform.

hero.h1: Lusha: Fast Contact Lookup for Sales Reps

org.verdict: Limited team features; better for individual use

rep.verdict: Fast and simple for daily prospecting

quickSummary.whatItDoes: Chrome extension for quick LinkedIn contact lookup ‚Äî find emails and phone numbers from LinkedIn profiles in seconds.
quickSummary.bestFor: Individual reps who need fast, low-friction contact data without complex platform setup or workflows.
quickSummary.pricing: Free (5 credits/mo). Pro from $29/mo. Scale from $51/mo. Enterprise custom.

paragraphs: Lusha is a contact intelligence platform designed for speed. Its Chrome extension lets sales reps pull verified emails and phone numbers from LinkedIn profiles with a single click. With a free tier and self-serve pricing, it's one of the lowest-friction prospecting tools available ‚Äî though the smaller database and limited features mean it works better for individual reps than for teams running complex enrichment workflows.
whatIs.noteHtml: Note: Based on vendor docs and G2 reviews, not firsthand testing. See Lusha on G2.

features.title: Chrome Extension
features.description: One-click contact lookup from LinkedIn profiles with email and phone reveal.

features.title: Free Tier
features.description: 5 credits per month at no cost; enough for light prospecting.

features.title: Bulk Enrichment
features.description: Upload CSV lists for batch contact enrichment on paid plans.

features.title: CRM Integration
features.description: Push contacts directly to Salesforce, HubSpot, or Pipedrive.

features.title: Team Management
features.description: Credit pooling and usage tracking on Scale and Enterprise plans.

features.title: API Access
features.description: REST API for programmatic contact enrichment on higher tiers.

pricing.note: Pricing from lusha.com. Verify on their site before purchasing.
pricing.creditNote: 1 credit = 1 contact reveal. Pro plan's 480 credits supports ~24 contacts per business day.

g2Reviews.intro: Based on 1,400+ reviews on G2 (4.3/5 rating):

pros.text: Chrome extension works instantly from LinkedIn
5 credits/month lets anyone try before buying
US email data is generally reliable
No training needed; install extension and start prospecting
Transparent pricing with no sales call required

cons.text: Less coverage than ZoomInfo or Apollo for niche industries
European contact data less reliable than US data
No sequences, email sending, or AI enrichment
480 credits on Pro burns fast for active prospectors
Direct dial accuracy lower than Cognism's verified numbers

goodFit.heading: Good Fit If You:
items: Need fast contact lookup from LinkedIn profiles
Want a simple tool with zero learning curve
Prefer self-serve pricing with a free tier to test
Are a solo rep or small team with basic prospecting needs
Want to push contacts directly to your CRM

notAFit.heading: Likely Not a Fit If You:
items: Need a large database for niche or vertical-specific prospecting
Want email sending or sequence automation built in
Prospect primarily in European markets (Cognism may be better)
Need AI enrichment or advanced workflow features

verdict.bestFor: Individual reps who want the fastest possible path from LinkedIn profile to verified contact data, with no setup or training required.
verdict.avoidIf: You need a comprehensive prospecting platform with email sending, AI enrichment, or large-scale data workflows.
verdict.bottomLine: Lusha does one thing well: fast contact lookup from LinkedIn. The free tier and Chrome extension make it the lowest-friction prospecting tool available, but you'll outgrow it quickly if you need more than basic contact data.

org.explain: Limited team management and no advanced workflows make it a poor fit for organizations needing scalable data infrastructure.

individual.explain: Speed and simplicity make it ideal for individual reps who need quick contact data without platform overhead.

decisionSnapshot.intro: Scores from 0–10 based on our scoring methodology.

rows.notes: Limited team management; better for SMB and individual use

evidence.text: Enterprise reviewers note lack of advanced admin controls and governance
Team features available on Scale plan but limited vs. enterprise tools
Mid-market teams report outgrowing Lusha within 6-12 months
Multiple threads recommend switching to ZoomInfo or Apollo at scale

rows.notes: Chrome extension installs in 2 minutes; no training needed

evidence.text: 92% of reviewers rate ease of use 4/5 or higher
Chrome extension onboarding takes under 5 minutes per rep
Consistently praised as the simplest prospecting tool available
Recommended as the first tool for new SDRs in multiple threads

rows.notes: No AI features; straightforward contact lookup and enrichment

evidence.text: No mentions of AI features in recent reviews
No AI enrichment, writing, or automation tools on the platform
Users note lack of AI features compared to newer tools like Clay or LeadIQ

rows.notes: Salesforce, HubSpot, Pipedrive; limited vs. enterprise tools

evidence.text: CRM integrations work but are basic compared to Cognism or ZoomInfo
Native Salesforce, HubSpot, Pipedrive connectors; API on Scale+
Reliable CRM push but no advanced sync or workflow triggers
Integration depth sufficient for SMB; enterprise teams need more

rows.notes: Clear public pricing with free tier; no sales call needed

evidence.text: All pricing published on lusha.com with feature breakdowns
Pricing transparency praised as a differentiator vs. Cognism/ZoomInfo
Users appreciate being able to start free and upgrade without sales calls

rows.notes: Credit model limits scale; expensive at high volume

evidence.text: Teams of 10+ report credit constraints on Pro and Scale plans
Cost per contact increases vs. enterprise tools at volume
Scales to 5-10 reps before teams typically migrate to larger platforms

evidenceSignals.confidenceNote: Based on 1,400+ G2 reviews, vendor documentation, and active community discussion. Strong signal quality with large review sample size.

evidenceGrid.text: Review sentiment: Praise: speed and simplicity. Complaint: small database and limited features
Community workflows: LinkedIn lookup, CRM push, basic list building
Demo-verified: Chrome extension, LinkedIn integration, CRM sync
Docs verified: Pricing tiers, credit allocations, API documentation

strengthThemes: Fastest path from LinkedIn to contact data
Free tier lowers barrier to entry for solo reps
Self-serve pricing with no sales process required
limitationThemes: Smaller database limits niche and vertical coverage
No email sending or sequence automation
Credit model becomes expensive at scale
evidenceSignals.disagreeNote: ⚠️ Where sources disagree: Vendor claims 80%+ email accuracy; some G2 reviewers report lower accuracy for EU contacts. Reddit users debate whether Lusha or Apollo is better value at the $29-49/mo price point.

userVoiceThemes.heading: Fastest prospecting tool for LinkedIn workflows
userVoiceThemes.synthesis: The dominant theme across all review platforms: Lusha's Chrome extension is the fastest way to get from a LinkedIn profile to verified contact data. Reps consistently report it takes under 10 seconds to reveal an email and phone number, with no platform login or workflow setup required.
userVoiceThemes.quote: "Lusha is the fastest prospecting tool I've ever used. Click the extension on LinkedIn, get the email, push to Salesforce. Done in 10 seconds."
userVoiceThemes.quoteCite: Synthesized from G2 and Capterra review themes

userVoiceThemes.heading: Database size limits coverage for niche industries
userVoiceThemes.synthesis: The most frequent complaint: Lusha's database is smaller than Apollo or ZoomInfo, leading to more missed contacts in niche industries, small companies, and non-US markets. Active prospectors report hitting dead ends more often than with larger databases.
userVoiceThemes.quote: "Lusha works great for standard B2B companies, but when I'm prospecting into niche verticals or companies under 50 employees, I get a lot of 'no data available' results."
userVoiceThemes.quoteCite: Synthesized from G2 and TrustRadius review themes

userVoiceThemes.heading: Free tier is great for testing but credits burn fast
userVoiceThemes.synthesis: Users appreciate the free tier as a no-risk entry point, but 5 credits per month is only enough for occasional prospecting. Even the Pro plan's 480 credits can run out quickly for active SDRs, pushing teams toward the more expensive Scale plan or considering alternatives like Apollo.
userVoiceThemes.quote: "Started on the free tier and loved the simplicity. But once I went Pro, I burned through 480 credits in two weeks. At that volume, Apollo's unlimited plan starts looking better."
userVoiceThemes.quoteCite: Synthesized from G2 and Capterra review themes

pricingBreakdown.tldr: Free (5 credits/mo). Most reps need Pro at $29/mo (480 credits). Scale at $51/mo adds team features.
gotchas: 5 free credits per month is only enough for testing
480 Pro credits = ~24 contacts/day if used evenly across 20 business days
No unlimited plan; high-volume teams hit credit ceilings fast
Annual billing gives ~20% discount vs. monthly

greatAt: Speed: Fastest Chrome extension for LinkedIn contact lookup, under 10 seconds per reveal
Simplicity: Zero learning curve; install and start prospecting immediately
Free entry: Free tier lets reps test before committing budget
Self-serve: No sales call required; transparent pricing for all tiers
CRM push: One-click export to Salesforce, HubSpot, or Pipedrive
breaksAtScale: Small database: Coverage gaps in niche industries and non-US markets
No sequences: Data-only tool; no email sending or outreach automation
Credit ceiling: Expensive per-contact at high volume vs. enterprise tools
EU data quality: European contact accuracy lags behind Cognism
Limited team features: No advanced admin controls or governance for large orgs
whoShouldNotBuy: Enterprise teams: Limited admin controls and governance features
High-volume prospectors: Credit model doesn't scale past ~50 contacts/day cost-effectively
EMEA-focused teams: Cognism provides better European data coverage and compliance
All-in-one seekers: No email sending, no sequences, no AI features

implementationReality.note: Install Chrome extension, create account, start revealing contacts. No setup, no onboarding, no training. Fastest time-to-value of any prospecting tool.

org.heading: Best for Sales Teams & RevOps
items: SMB sales teams needing a simple, low-cost prospecting tool
Startups wanting to avoid enterprise sales processes for data tools
Teams supplementing a larger database with quick LinkedIn lookups

individual.heading: Best for Individual Reps
items: SDRs who live in LinkedIn and need fast contact reveals
Solo prospectors on a budget who want to start free
Reps who want the simplest possible tool with zero setup

cards.title: Apollo.io
cards.description: Lusha for quick lookup; Apollo for sequences and email sending.

cards.title: Instantly
cards.description: Lusha finds contacts; Instantly sends cold email at scale.

cards.title: HubSpot CRM
cards.description: Push Lusha contacts directly into HubSpot for pipeline management.

cards.title: Outreach
cards.description: Lusha data feeds Outreach sequences for multi-channel outreach.

cards.title: Lavender
cards.description: Lusha finds the contact; Lavender helps write the email.

faqs.question: Is Lusha free to use?
faqs.answer: Yes, Lusha offers a free tier with 5 credits per month. This is enough for light prospecting but most active reps need the Pro plan at $29/month for 480 credits.

faqs.question: How accurate is Lusha's contact data?
faqs.answer: Lusha claims 80%+ email accuracy. Based on G2 reviews, US email data is generally reliable but EU contacts and phone numbers are less accurate than Cognism.

faqs.question: Is Lusha better than Apollo?
faqs.answer: Lusha is simpler and faster for basic contact lookup. Apollo offers a larger database, email sending, and CRM features. Choose Lusha for speed; Apollo for an all-in-one platform.

finalCta.heading: Learn More About Lusha
finalCta.description: Visit their site for current pricing, the Chrome extension, and a free tier to get started.
